Entries.default: "Those Roparu dare make such racket in MY longhouse? What were those Royal Deadfire fools thinking!" A large Huana man glares down the length of the building, his fists clenched tight.
"At least the Royal Deadfire Company built you a better home."
"It's shame the Company stuck you in here with all the common folk."
"You'd feel the same if you knew anything about the Huana." The warrior grunts, a sneer lifting his lip.

"I don't need a better house. I need PRIVACY!"

He throws up his arms with a wordless shout. A brief hush falls over the longhouse at the Mataru's outburst.
"Hmph. At least someone understands the proper way of things." The warrior mumbles the words just loud enough for you to hear them.
"How long have you been gone from the Deadfire that you can't see what an affront this is to our people? Pah!" The warrior grunts, a sneer lifting his lip.
"Stone walls and cannons do not improve the village - they only make us a target."
"Your room's much nicer than the others."
"Why would the Roparu steal your stuff?"
"How did the Royal Deadfire Company come to control Sayuka?"
"I am Mataru, a warrior. The best quarters are mine by right."
"Can Ngati even hear my prayers over all this noise?"

"And yet I cannot display my most precious possession - my grandmother's war hammer - for fear the Roparu might steal it.

"It is absurd!"
"They know no better. A Huana soul is not born into the Roparu without reason, after all." He can hardly resist rolling his eyes.
"Not even the greatest Mataru can stand against a fleet of Rauataian war ships." The warrior speaks with a bitter shake of his head.
